meanings.definition: To make something higher or more elevated.
meanings.sent1: She was heightening the shelf to reach the top.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers were heightening the tower with more bricks.
meanings.sent3: The cat was heightening its perch on the tree to spy on the birds.
meanings.sent4: His excitement was heightening as he climbed higher on the roller coaster.
meanings.sent5: The sun was heightening in the sky, casting longer shadows.

meanings.definition: To increase the intensity or degree of something.
meanings.sent1: The chef was heightening the flavor of the soup with extra spices.
meanings.sent2: The music producer was heightening the bass in the song for a stronger beat.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was heightening the audience's laughter with his funny gestures.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was heightening as the argument escalated.
meanings.sent5: The storm was heightening in strength, with thunder rumbling louder.

meanings.definition: To become more intense or extreme.
meanings.sent1: The colors of the sunset were heightening, painting the sky with vibrant hues.
meanings.sent2: The anxiety was heightening as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent3: The drama in the movie was heightening with each unexpected twist.
meanings.sent4: The suspense was heightening as the detective got closer to solving the case.
meanings.sent5: The heat was heightening, making everyone seek shade from the sun.
